page.title: 13Local Customs in Uzmaston
page.content: In June the Mayor of Haverfordwest, who is Admiral of the Port, together with members of the Council, come down the river in two boats to Whitestone Rock near Goodwood. This marks the boundary on the Western Cleddau and the ceremony is called Beating the Bounds. On Christmas Eve a midnight service is held at Uzmaston Church. Holy Eucharist is celebrated and the service is fully choral. The church is beautifully decorated with flowers, holly, mistletoe and a lighted tree. The Deanery Sunday School Festival is held on Trinity Sunday, at one church in the Deanery. A special preacher catechizes the children and the host church provides them with tea before Evensong. The annual choir outing this year was to Caldy Island, where Uzmaston Choir sang. Each Easter there is a sponsored walk for Church funds.
